intro: Dalea holwayi, commonly known as Holway's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it produces small, legume-like pods that contain the seeds. Dalea holwayi is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
